name: Ruy Lopez
description: One of the oldest and most classical chess openings, named after 16th-century Spanish priest Ruy LÃ³pez.
strategy: White aims to control the center and develop pieces quickly while maintaining pressure on Black's e5 pawn.

name: Ruy Lopez: Berlin Defense
pgn: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nf6
description: Solid but somewhat passive defense, very popular at the highest level due to its drawish nature.
strategy: Black develops the knight to f6, attacking the e4 pawn and preparing quick development.

name: Ruy Lopez: Morphy Defense
pgn: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6
description: The most classical response, leading to rich middlegame positions with chances for both sides.
strategy: Black challenges the Spanish bishop immediately, forcing a decision about its placement.

name: Ruy Lopez: Steinitz Defense
pgn: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 d6
description: Solid but passive setup, defending the e5 pawn directly.
strategy: Black defends the e5 pawn with the d6 move, creating a solid but somewhat cramped position.

name: Ruy Lopez: Schliemann Defense
pgn: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 f5
description: Aggressive but risky counterattack, seeking immediate kingside play.
strategy: Black launches an immediate counterattack on the kingside with f5, sacrificing pawn structure for activity.
